forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South southeast wind around 16 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 4am, then showers and thunderstorms. Some of the storms could produce heavy rain. Cloudy, with a low around 53. South southeast wind 17 to 28 mph, with gusts as high as 51 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between 1 and 2 inches possible.

weather_report:
The afternoon in Downtown San Francisco envelops the city in a soft embrace of rain and cloud, transforming the familiar into something more mysterious and reflective. The chill of the air lingers, with the temperature slowly dipping toward that eventide coolness, whispering through the streets as gusty winds rustle leaves and scatter the remnants of fallen rain. It’s a day where the colors deepen under the blanket of grey; the world feels rich with the promise of a storm. The Golden Gate stands just out of sight, shrouded in the haze, while the sound of raindrops begins to punctuate the city’s usual rhythm.

As night descends, prepare for heavier showers and thunderstorms that may command your attention with their intensity. The kind of downpour that saturates the air with a sense of urgency, accompanied by the dramatic dance of lightning illuminating the shadows. Dressing warmly in layers, perhaps with a reliable raincoat, will serve you well, as will sturdy footwear suitable for puddled streets. As the storm unfolds, consider retreating to a cozy café, where you can watch the world through rain-slicked windows, or perhaps to a bookstore, losing yourself amidst stories while the weather tells its own tale outside. Let the evening be an invitation to indulge in the comfort of home, a movie, or a warm cup of tea as nature performs its symphony throughout the city.
